title: ã€Website Recomendationã€‘removegptwatermark.comï¼šFree tool to detect and remove invisible Unicode watermarks from AI-generated text
content:
I built a client-side tool that detects and removes 30+ types of invisible Unicode characters (zero-width spaces, joiners, em dashes) that AI systems like ChatGPT (Gemini, Claude) may use for watermarking text.

â€¢ 100% client-side - your text never leaves your browser
â€¢ Detects zero-width spaces (U+200B), joiners (U+200D), and other invisible markers
â€¢ Real-time detection with character visualization
â€¢ No registration, no tracking, completely free
â€¢ Multi-language support (EN/DE/ES)

try it out:
https://removegptwatermark.com/

[YouComic.org](https://youcomic.org), an AI-powered all-in-one comic creation platform designed to make manga creation accessible to everyone.
With YouComic, users can generate characters, scenes, dialogues, and storyboards â€” no drawing skills required.

Our vision is to make comic creation as easy as storytelling.
From character design to scene composition, coloring, and translation, YouComic provides intelligent tools to support every step of the creative process.

å‡ è¡Œä»£ç å°±å¯ä»¥ç›´æ¥ä½¿ç”¨æ³¨å†Œçš„mcpæœåŠ¡ è¿™ä¸ªäº§å‡ºçš„toolçš„åˆ—è¡¨å®Œå…¨å’Œllmæˆ–è€…agentæ¡†æ¶å…¼å®¹ä½¿ç”¨

```python
from langchain.agents import create_tool_calling_agent, AgentExecutor
from langchain_core.prompts import ChatPromptTemplate
from langchain_openai import ChatOpenAI
from mcpstore import MCPStore
store = MCPStore.setup_store()
store.for_store().add_service({"name":"mcpstore-wiki","url":"https://mcpstore.wiki/mcp"})
tools = store.for_store().for_langchain().list_tools()

llm = ChatOpenAI(
    temperature=0, model="deepseek-chat",
    openai_api_key="sk-****",
    openai_api_base="httpss://api.deepseek.com"
)
prompt = ChatPromptTemplate.from_messages([
    ("system", "ä½ æ˜¯ä¸€ä¸ªåŠ©æ‰‹ï¼Œå›ç­”çš„æ—¶å€™å¸¦ä¸Šè¡¨æƒ…"),
    ("human", "{input}"),
    ("placeholder", "{agent_scratchpad}"),
])
agent = create_tool_calling_agent(llm, tools, prompt)
agent_executor = AgentExecutor(agent=agent, tools=tools, verbose=True)
query = "åŒ—äº¬çš„å¤©æ°”æ€ä¹ˆæ ·ï¼Ÿ"
print(f"\n   ğŸ¤”: {query}")
response = agent_executor.invoke({"input": query})
print(f"   ğŸ¤– : {response['output']}")
```
